section.title: Libration Point
section.para: This was created using the July 9, 2008 build of GMAT.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The object Libration Point allows you to add a special point that can be used as a reference point or a point to be used for the plots. The libration point, also called a Lagrange point, is a point in space that a satellite can orbit about even though there is no central body. it is a phenomenon of a three-body system. It is part of the resource tree and can be added under Solar System.

section.title: Listing of Objects and Commands that interact

listitem.para: Interacts with libration point in that libration point can be selected as the origin of the coordinate system or as a primary or secondary point for defining the axes.

Interacts with a libration point in a number of ways. It can be selected as a celestial object to be drawn onto the plot. A libration point can also be selected as the View Point Reference or the View Direction.
Interacts with a libration point in that the bary center can be selected as the primary or secondary body for calculating the libration point.
This is the main body of the system, picked from the list of celestial bodies.
This is the second body that will be used to perform calculations in the system for the finding of the libration point.

The other option is to select which libration point is wanted. There are a total of 5 libration points. The first libration point is between the two bodies. The second libration point is in a line from the primary body, through the secondary body, to the libration point. The third libration point is in a line from the secondary body through the primary body, out to the libration point. The fourth and fifth libration points are nearly on the orbit path of the secondary body, placed symmetrically. For more information, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libration_point .

entry.para: Options: [Sun, Mercury, Venus, Earth, Luna, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto], or any Barycenter. ( The Primary and Secondary bodies cannot be the same )]
The Primary field tells GMAT which body to consider the primary body in the calculation of the location of a libration point.
Options: [Sun, Mercury, Venus, Earth, Luna, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto, or any Barycenter. ( The Primary and Secondary bodies cannot be the same )]
The Secondary field tells GMAT which body to consider the secondary body in the calculation of the location of a libration point.
The Point field specifies which libration point the object corresponds to.
